subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0008_01C9BAEB.EACC0590
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I am not concerned about negative repercussions from any entities. My only =
concern is eliminating bias.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: HKacz=
marek 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, April 11, 2009 2:24=
 PM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter s=
tuff.








  LOL! I use mine by myself and have for years. I now do auto=
matic writing (Ouija too slow), and I've never had any issues at all. I do =
not do anything before I pick up the board, but I do say goodbye when I'm d=
one. More out of courtesy (even if it's just to my own mind).



  Heather
=






  and no evil spirits or poltegeist visited you as george noory sugge=
sted or warned us about when playing with the ouija board?

  --- In EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > Exactly. =
And it may even be that it's both-sometimes it is us, but once in a while a=
nd actual entity comes through. But until I can really study it over a peri=
od time, I am just not convinced either way.
  > 
  > ----- Original Messag=
e ----- 
  > From: Zack Widup 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: S=
aturday, April 11, 2009 1:10 AM
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alternative t=
o the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > I tried a=
n Ouija board once. My brother and I were given one by my grandmother, who =
found it in her attic. After asking many questions and getting all sorts of=
 answers that ranged from gibberish to the totally absurd, I think we decid=
ed there was something in our joint subconsciouses that was making the plan=
chette give the answers it did.
  > 
  > That may not always be the case, t=
hough. I think if answers of some sort were given involving something that =
no one present would have the faintest idea about, and they turned out to b=
e true or valid, then it might demonstrate spirit communication.
  > 
  > Z=
ack
  > 
  > 
  > On Fri, Apr 10, 2009 at 11:37 PM, April Abercrombie <apri=
l@...> wrote:
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Well, if my husband would let me=
 actually experiment with one, that would be the first step LOL!
  > 
  > B=
ut what I would try and do is get some kind of verifiable information from =
the "entity" that I contact with the board to prove that it is communicatio=
n from an actual, intelligent being and not just my own motor responses mak=
ing he planchette move. It would have to be information that I have no know=
ledge of.
  > 
  > If I could do that, and consistently, then I would be co=
mfortable saying that I am actually talking to a spirit.
  > 
  > The reaso=
n I have my doubts is that you have to be touching the planchette to get it=
 to move. If it were an actual spirit, I would think that shouldn't be nece=
ssary. We all know ghosts can a do move objects.
  > 
  > But this brings u=
p another mystery - if the Ouija board is actual spirit communication, mayb=
e there is a difference between the entities you can contact with it and yo=
ur common ghost.
  > 
  > April
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > =
From: lori bogren 
  > To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Friday, April=
 10, 2009 9:50 PM
  > Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual gh=
ost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > April~
  > 
  > Hm, finally I'm intrigued a=
gain.
  > 
  > How do you about the process?
  > 
  > ~Lori
  > 
  > 
  > 
=
  > 
  > "My life is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." 
  > --Anne Ri=
ce Responding to an interviewer who just did not get it. 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  =
> 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > ------------------------------------------------=
----------
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  > From: april@...
  > Date: Fr=
i, 10 Apr 2009 18:36:30 -0600
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to =
the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > .
  > 
  > 
  > When it comes t=
o the Ouija, I just want to study it to find out if it is really spirit com=
munication, or just kinetic energy or your subconscious mind moving the pla=
nchette.
  > 
  > I agree that we all have the ability for extra sensory pe=
rception, just some are better at it than others. Like running, for instanc=
e. We all can run, but some are naturally better at it. Still, with practic=
e we can get better.
  > 
  > But that is not my aim with the Ouija.
  > 
 =
 > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: lori bogren 
  > To: evp-it=
c@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Friday, April 10, 2009 6:11 PM
  > Subject: RE=
: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > A=
pril~
  > 
  > You forgot yawn from boredom, that's what I do.
  > 
  > Use=
 it, don't use it. I don't care. But why bother. When people ask me I usual=
ly suggest that if they want to communicate with ... whatever why not devel=
op the ability yourself. - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyone can.
  >=
 
  > There's always the question in the back of your mind whether your par=
tner's moving it. The intentions of "what" you are talking to. Not to menti=
on it's too slow and limited.
  > 
  > Besides if you take the time to deve=
lop the ability you can get more texture in the information. Asking the boa=
rd "where you married?" may get you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sen=
se of a religious or civil ceremonhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the p=
arty, or whether that Being approved/disapproved of their spouse (ie was it=
 a reluctant union).
  > 
  > ~Lori 
  > 
  > 
  >
